sub_title: Professor AI in Radiotherapy / president of EuSoMII
summary:
Currently working as Professor in the field of Artificial Intelligence in Radiotherapy at the department of Radiation Oncology and as Coordinator of the Machine Learning Lab of the Data Science Center in Health, both at the University Medical Center Groningen. 
In Radiotherapy, AI is increasingly becoming a key enabling technology. My research supports the department research strategy by focusing on using AI to perform automated segmentations of tumours and normal tissues (organs at risk), predict tumour control and toxicity, and automate radiotherapy treatment planning (photons and protons). The goal is to translate my research outcomes into clinical practice to enable more individualized approaches and to achieve seamless image guided adaptive radiotherapy strategies with optimal human-machine interfaces to allow responsible implementation and use of AI.
As data science expert for DASH I contribute to diverse research projects in different departments, applying my expert knowledge on data science and machine learning to a variety of UMCG departments. This ranges from advice in the application of machine learning, aid in writing workpackages for research proposals, to actual support of research projects together with the data scientists of DASH.

I am (Co)Author of over 180 international, peer reviewed, publications (enlisted in PubMed) and (co)author of numerous other publications, book chapters and conference abstracts. This results in an h-factor of 35 according to the scopus ranking.

As a Board member of the European Society of Medical Imaging Informatics (EuSoMII) I am involved in the education and research on Medical Imaging Informatics on a European Scale. For 2023-2024 I am te president of this learned society.

projects.title: How AI Can Support Healthcare - AIProHealth
projects.description: As part of the AIProHealth project, funded by EIT Health, we developed a free massive open online course "How Artificial Intelligence can Support Healthcare" on Futurelearn. Follow the provided link and take this free short course (4 weeks, 4 hours per week) to get ready for the new era of Healthcare with integrated, responsible, Artificial Intelligence.

profile_positions.description: The Machine Learning Lab aims to unite people working in the field of data science at the UMCG. To this aim I coordinate a board consisting of data scientists from different departments. With this board we plan and organize meetings and educational activities for our data science community. Members of this community are from a variety of departments but they have in common that they - regardless of their role or background - are all involved in the implementation and use of data science in medical research.

volunteer_experiences.description:
www.duradexchange.nl

The purpose of the foundation is:

- to improve the quality and accessibility of radiological patientcare in developing countries,
- to investigate and develop effective models and strategies to make knowledge accessable and applicable in developing countries,
- to promote (international) collaboration between healthcare professionals, especially concerning the radiology.
Translating letters from sponsors from Dutch to English and letters from sponsored children from all over the world from English into Dutch.
